subject: Baseball
Historic Buildings and Sites
Stadiums and Arenas
lead_paragraph: League Park, formerly a home of the Cleveland Indians, has remained virtually untouched since the stadium was razed in 1951, but it is expected to reopen later this year in turn-back-the-clock glory.
snippet: League Park, formerly a home of the Cleveland Indians, has remained virtually untouched since the stadium was razed in 1951, but it is expected to reopen later this year in turn-back-the-clock glory.
